Description: Base of a Black Ware Nile silt small pottery bowl, inside and outside covered with brown-black slip, that resembles black glaze. Reduced grey Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.170) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2988 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
